availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Morgan B. Perry (Henry County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Washington Perry and Martha Perry. Resident of Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Henry County resident in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Farmer in Henry County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 377B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 26.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 179B.
_"Morgan Bryan Perry (1837-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial #8169369, accessed October 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8169369.
